result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on December 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.

12:57 PM Defendant Matthew J. Beck Jr. not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Matthew J. Beck Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC.  Court notes mail is being returned.  Atty Hayes does not have an updated address.  Atty Hayes received an offer today.  Atty Hayes is unsure if she will be requesting a trial.

records.addlTxt:
2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J. Beck Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison A Markoski appeared by video for Matthew J. Beck Jr.  Court states case and appearances.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State makes bail recommendations.  Atty Markoski responds - new mailing address provided.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $250.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  Not to possess any controlled substances whatsoever.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
